definitions.definition: The state of being a minor ; youth , the period of a person's life prior to reaching adulthood .
Any subgroup that does not form a numerical majority .
examples: Most people agreed, but a sizable minority were upset by the decision.

definitions.definition: A member of an ethnic minority.
examples: The company claims it has hired several minorities since the complaint was lodged.

definitions.definition: A group of people seen as distinct who are subordinated and discriminated against in a society .

main_definition: The state of being a minor ; youth , the period of a person's life prior to reaching adulthood . [from 15th c.]
secondary_definitions: Any subgroup that does not form a numerical majority . [from 18th c.]
( US ) A member of an ethnic minority. [from 20th c.]
( sociology ) A group of people seen as distinct who are subordinated and discriminated against in a society .
